description: Early 20th CE excavations revealed large amounts of Iron Age and Roman material. No structures were found but roof and flue tile suggested one was present, it is now interpreted as having been a shrine.
bibliography: A Roman Road, a Roman Temple and a Romano-British River Name: Kingston Deverill, “Defereal”, Wilts. YouTube, 2024. https://youtu.be/dAjirKBZrKA.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Colerne Park Wood (Wiltshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Nan Kivell. “Objects Found during Excavations on the Romano-British Site at Cold Kitchen Hill, Brixton, Deverill, 1924.” The Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Magazine 43 (1927).
———. “Objects Found during Excavations on the Romano-British Site at Cold Kitchen Hill, Brixton, Deverill, 1926.” The Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Magazine 44 (1929).
